page.description: When you create a PhoneGap project, you can include pre-populated SQLite database files as part of the PhoneGap project.

section.description: A genie allows you to create the SQLite databases that you include with your PhoneGap project. Watch the videos below to learn more:

video.name: Including Pre-populated SQLite Database Files in a PhoneGap Project Part 1
Including Pre-populated SQLite Database Files in a PhoneGap Project Part 2

description.p: If your PhoneGap project includes pre-populated SQLite databases, your UX component can work with the data in these SQLite databases using Action Javascript. See [PhoneGap - SQLite Actions] for more information.
If you are including pre-populated SQLite databases in your project, be sure to specify the following PhoneGap plugins: *[ui:Device]*, *[ui:File]*, *[ui:File Transfer]*, *[ui:SQLitePluginExt]*.
To define the SQLite databases that should be part of your PhoneGap project, click the smart field for the *[ui:SQLite Databases]* property in the PhoneGap Genie.
This will open a dialog where you can define your SQLite databases.

Your project can include multiple SQLite databases and each database can include multiple tables. Each SQLite database is contained in a single file and this file is automatically added to the *[ui:Additional Files Required]* setting in the builder.
You can choose to put all of the tables you want in your SQLite databases in a single SQLite database, or you can use multiple SQLite databases - the choice is yours.

Once you add a new SQLite database to the above dialog, you can click the *[ui:Define SQLite Database Contents]* button to specify the tables that should be in the SQLite database. For each table that you specify you can define how the table should be populated. The options are to perform a SQL query to extract data from any SQL database supported by AlphaDAO, static data, or Xbasic. If you choose the Xbasic option, you can specify Xbasic code that will return data that are used to populate a table.

Once you have defined the SQLite databases, click the *[ui:Create SQLite Database Files]* button to actually create the SQLite database files. These files will be created in the *[www]* folder in your PhoneGap project.

section.note: Contrast creating pre-populated SQLite databases with making an Ajax callback to the server and dynamically creating the SQLite database. Dynamically creating SQLite databases is a built-in action in Action Javasascript. See [PhoneGap - SQLite Actions].
